contentrichtext.text: '''Quonochontaug''' is composed of three small beach communities in [[Charlestown, Rhode Island|Charlestown]], [[Rhode Island]], [[USA]]. Located between two salt ponds, [[Ninigret Pond]] and [[Quonochontaug Pond]], and their respective barrier beaches, the communities of West Beach, Central Beach, and East Beach house several hundred mostly summer residents. Today, many houses are available as summer rentals. Quonochontaug was a busy and fashionable resort of small hotels and boarding houses in the 19th Century, continuing up until the [[New England Hurricane of 1938|Great Hurricane of 1938]]. {{Citation needed|date=March 2007}} Blue Shutters Beach, where fast food can be purchased, is located at the end of East Beach Road in Quonochontaug. To the east of Blue Shutters an unpaved road leads to the entrance of the [[Ninigret National Wildlife Refuge]]. The areas was listed as a [[census-designated place]] in the 2010 census.<ref>{{gnis|2631339}}</ref> ==In popular culture== * In the [[The X-Files|X-Files]] there are several references to Quonochontaug. [[Fox Mulder|Mulder]] spent some of his childhood's vacations in a house that his parents owned there. In season 3 finale ([[Talitha Cumi (The X-Files)|Talitha Cumi]]), [[Fox Mulder|Mulder]] gets a call from [[Walter Skinner|AD Skinner]], who tells him that [[List of The X-Files characters#Teena Mulder|his mother]] has been admitted to a hospital in Quonochontaug. In season 4 episode 23 [[Demons (The X-Files)|Demons]], Mulder visits Quonochontaug in an attempt to find answers to his past. ==Historic Places== *[[Babcock House (Charlestown, Rhode Island)|Babcock House]] ==History== Quonochontaug was the site of an iron mining operation financed by Thomas A. Edison in the 1880s. Iron particles existed in the form of black sand on the beach and they could be separated out with magnets and melted to produce iron. The venture failed after cheaper iron was later discovered.<ref>http://edison.rutgers.edu/NamesSearch/DocDetImage.php3</ref> and here <ref>http://edison.rutgers.edu/NamesSearch/glocpage.php3?gloc=D8139&</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == *[http://qeba.org/ Quonochontaug East Beach Association] {{Washington County, Rhode Island}} {{coord|41|20|08|N|71|42|30|W|type:city_region:US-RI|display=title}} [[Category:Villages in Washington County, Rhode Island]] [[Category:Census-designated places in Washington County, Rhode Island]] [[Category:Providence metropolitan area]] {{RhodeIsland-geo-stub}}
